thread.title_full: Former EBay CFO Swan Joins Private Equity Firm General Atlantic - Bloomberg Business

author: Devin Banerjee
title: Former EBay CFO Swan Joins Private Equity Firm General Atlantic
text:
Former EBay Inc. finance chief Bob Swan is joining General Atlantic to help the private equity firm manage Internet and technology investments and find new deals.
Swan, 55, will be an operating partner in the Palo Alto office, Greenwich, Connecticut-based General Atlantic said Tuesday. He left EBay, the online marketplace operator, in July after nine years as chief financial officer and remains on the San Jose, California-based company’s board.
Private equity firms are increasingly hiring industry experts both to differentiate themselves when buying companies and to work on improving the businesses, rather than relying on leverage and rising markets for investment returns. General Atlantic, which this year acquired stakes in companies including Uber Technologies Inc. and Airbnb Inc., previously hired Gary Reiner, General Electric Co.’s former chief information officer, and Anish Batlaw, a former operating partner at buyout firm TPG Capital.
Blackstone Group LP, the biggest buyout firm, counts former Unilever chief operating officer Harish Manwani and former Boeing Co. executive Jim Albaugh among its senior advisers. At KKR & Co., advisers include David Cote, who is Honeywell International Inc.’s chief executive officer, and former Caterpillar Inc. Chairman Jim Owens. Carlyle Group LP this year added former Wal-Mart Stores Inc. CEO Mike Duke to advise on consumer and retail deals.
“Bob’s deep expertise in the Internet and technology sector will make him an exceptional asset,” Bill Ford, General Atlantic’s CEO, said in the statement.
General Atlantic, started in 1980, oversaw $17.4 billion as of June.
